programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Capt Blackadder tries every trick in the book to escape the trenches before the big push, including pretending to be insane - but ends up going over the top with sidekicks Baldrick and George. Final episode of the comedy, guest starring Geoffrey Palmer, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called to examine the bodies recovered from a fatal helicopter crash, and her findings soon threaten to rip through the heart of the community living around the airfield. Drama about a forensic pathologist, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Reg organises a half-centenary celebration of Sun Hill, attended by dignitaries including former DCS Charles Barnett. On a less happy note, Amanda Prosser's insensitive treatment of a bereaved father provokes a hostage crisis, and the real Gabriel Kent turns up out of the blue, spelling big trouble for the unscrupulous copper who has assumed his identity.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Carole is left in charge while Nick goes away to a conference, but things do not exactly go as smoothly as she would have hoped. Meanwhile, a new fire-fighter joins the team.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Fowlers are determined not to rise to the Chapman's bait. Phil is late for Kathy's party and Mandy & Aidan are left out in the cold.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Ian King Live
programme.desc: All the day's business news live from Sky's City of London studio, with Ian King.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: In the final episode, Harry, John and the team embark on the final leg of the tour in Germany, as they prepare to face their arch-rivals at the Wacker Arena in Burghausen. After checking into their Hotel in the Bavarian Alps, Harry receives the German team sheet, leaving him concerned his team are going to have to massively step up their game. With the fear of the match going to penalties hanging over their head, Harry brings in a German psychologist to offer some advice. Finally the big day arrives, and Harry has managed to recruit Manchester United legend Teddy Sheringham, so the team finally has its missing striker.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a large game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of £10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Rolls-Royce but takes a chance when offered a 1984 Bentley Mulsanne Turbo, much to the dismay of Edd China when he sees the paintwork.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton travels the world to view vehicles and memorabilia worth buying and restoring. In the first edition, the larger-than-life Londoner gets his hands on a 70-year-old Volkswagen Schwimmwagen - an amphibious car that he test-drives through a lake at a country fare.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: In the wake of his mother's death, Paul Sr is determined to reconcile with Mikey and Paul Jr, while OCC builds a bike for Veterans Airlift Command.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The legacy of the American flying boat, which was once used for both commerce and combat.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe carries out repairs at 300ft to help keep the sails turning on a wind farm, before cleaning up a sink hole in Kentucky.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: A look at the Bentley Continental GT Speed and how it is built.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The development of car manufacturing processes, continuing with a visit to the birthplace of the Alfa Romeo 4C to reveal its inner workings.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How convictions were secured in three murder cases through the gathering of trace evidence, including luminol blood testing and fingerprinting.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 26-year-old pregnant student Loretta Saunders. Her body was found 12 days after she went missing in February 2014, dumped off a Canadian highway, hundreds of miles from her home. Heavy snow had prevented it from being discovered earlier.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from 2008, when the discovery of the bullet-riddled bodies of 11-year-old Skyla Whitaker and 13-year-old Taylor Placker sent the Oklahoma community of Weleetka into a state of panic.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How stepbrothers Jamie McMahan and Chris Kauffman, responsible for a murder and robbery spree, were tracked down in Florida following a TV appeal for information.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators revisit animals from previous rescues to get updates on their progress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex needs to find out what is wrong with a dog struggling with a heatwave. A pregnant guinea pig is being watched closely, while Dr Kate helps a baby wombat.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie's sister persuades her to ditch the tomboy look, Courtney searches for a ball gown and Jennifer orders a dress too small for her to make her lose weight.
